_comment: MACA Debate Configuration - Customize for your domain

agents._comment_count: Number of agents (M). Recommended: 3-7. More agents = more diverse reasoning but slower.
agents._comment_model: Base model for debates. Options: qwen2.5:3b, llama3:8b, mistral:7b, etc.
agents._comment_endpoint: Ollama API endpoint. Use local for privacy.
agents._comment_temperature: Response diversity. 0.7-0.9 recommended. Higher = more diverse.

rounds._comment_total: Number of debate rounds (R). 2 is standard (independent â†’ peer feedback).

round_1.name: independent
round_1.description: Agents respond independently without seeing others' responses

round_2.name: peer_feedback
round_2.description: Agents can see and respond to peer reasoning

consensus._comment_method: How consensus is calculated. majority_voting is standard.
consensus._comment_min: Minimum consensus to keep debate. 0.5 = at least 50% agreement.

optimal_range._comment_range: Sweet spot for training. Too high (unanimous) = no training signal. Too low = poor quality.

filtering._comment_unanimous: If true, keeps 100% consensus debates. Usually false (no training signal).
filtering._comment_ambiguous: If true, keeps <50% consensus debates. Usually false (poor quality).
filtering._comment_range: Only keep debates with consensus in this range.

dpo_generation._comment_format: Output format. huggingface_trl is standard for training.
